intro: Uropetalon susianum, commonly known as the Susian starwort, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped white flowers and hairy, lanceolate leaves. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
